about_the_game:
In this gym run by old Martín, former professional boxer, he will be the one who trains you to get the best out of you, you will test your agility, reflexes, concentration, coordination, patience, perseverance... in the three types of training it offers Until now the gym, he trains with the "punching bag", the "speed bag" and the "boxing ball". Improve your stats such as your "strength", "critical blows", "aiming", "defense" and "dodge blows" to see them in action above the ring in each sparring match. Your gym mates will always give you good advice to lift your spirits and improve as a boxer, even though they are very rude in practice (sparring against the CPU).

Notes from old Martin:

Each boxer must complete rigorous training to get into the ring:

  • Train with the "punching bag" to improve your "strength" and your "critical blows".

  • Train with the "speed bag" to improve your "aiming" and your "defense".

  • Train with the "boxing ball" to improve your "dodge blows".

  • Each training increases your "energy" and lowers your "fatigue" to improve your health recovery in sparring, improve your recovery after receiving a KO, improve your breathing to launch consecutive blows.

If you want to face someone in sparring you need to train with the "punching bag", the "speed bag" and the "boxing ball" to achieve at least:

  • 15% of your "strength" on average.

  • 25% of your "aiming" on average.

  • 5% of your "dodge blows" on average.

Despite the protections and rules of sparring... not being properly prepared would be dangerous and you wouldn't last a round.

If you train hard, exceeding the minimum of your statistics to get into the ring, you will be more aware of your physical condition and that of your rival in sparring:

  • 22.5% of your "strength", 37.5% of your "aiming" and 7.5% of your "dodge blows" on average to display your "health" in combat.

  • 30% of your "strength", 50% of your "aiming" and 10% of your "dodge blows" on average to visualize your opponent's "health" and "fatigue" in combat.

Try to get 100% of your potential and fill your fight history with victories.

name: GymFistprint
short_description: GymFistprint is a boxing gym where we train hard to measure our skills with people from all over the world, do old Martín's training, test your limits and get your maximum potential.
supported_languages: English, French, Spanish - Spain, Simplified Chinese, Spanish - Latin America, Japanese, Portuguese - Brazil, Portuguese - Portugal, Russian
